attributes.action: Tackle car thefts with undercover bait cars
attributes.additional_details:
Car thefts are happening every single day in the same neighbourhood and residents are posting doorbell camera videos online of criminals trying car doors or abusing keyless entry cars. When cars are stolen, the public are paying the price through increased insurance premiums and manufacturers are not doing enough. 

Bait cars would allow the criminal to drive away, whilst they're tracked, furthermore remote deadlocking can be used to allow an arrest of all suspects in the getaway.
attributes.background: The police force should distribute bait vehicles around problematic neighbourhoods where car crime is high. This would not be under entrapment as the vehicle is like any other vehicle, There would be no visible valuables inside the vehicle to encourage a crime.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for. 
 
Decisions about police tactics are a matter for the police, not the UK Government or Parliament.
